review_title: AIF is a really great place to work!
job_title: Head Of Human Resources in Brisbane
pros: Team, work from home model, work, leadership, adaptive, agile, responsive, fun, always focussed on continuous improvement and ways to grow. Forward thinking. Supportive. Transparancy. Small team but wide ranging impact on our Warriors. Favourite workplace I've had.
cons: We were only limited at times by the external environment impacting our industry after 2020 meaning we couldn't always achieve everything we are ready for.

pros:
- Amazing culture
- Competent leadership team
- Reward hard work
- Good remuneration
- Leadership progression opportunities
- Excellent reputation
- Dynamic and flexible
cons: - Due to the size and spread of the organisation, it can be hard to get to know team members in other areas

pros: Flexible working conditions, good staff morale
cons: No incentive for more positive outcomes, salary wise in current roles except if in sales

pros:
The Institute is a vibrant and energetic place to work, with great opportunity for those who have initiative to grab it.  I have worked in a multitude of different roles over 10 + years with AIF and once my performance was proven and trust built, workplace flexibility became the most valued perk for me as I became a working mum.    

AIF is a national company that uses latest technology to break down barriers for remote staff to ensure we stay connected and engaged.  Over the years I have seen staff leave and return, which truly is a testament to the working experience at the AIF.  We play hard but have fun along the way.
cons: None for me, but if the culture is not your vibe then it may not be for you.

pros: Everyone who works here is so bubbly and loves their jobs!  You can truly feel the difference working in a company where everyone WANTS to be there. It is a breath of fresh air after previous jobs I have had! They are huge on growth and role progression. They care about their staff, and this is evident in the way they act and check in on you!
cons: There literally are no cons. I am loving my job, and this workplace.

review_title: Check your ethics at the door
pros: Quality training in a fun industry sector, other work mates were great to be around, some flexibility with hours
cons:
Evening and weekend work not negotiable (must be done)
High pressure, emotional selling means 50% of the students don't really want to be there
LLN screening not done properly (it gets in the way of selling), so many students not capable of doing the course
Training Team not respected, the whole business just focuses on the sales team
No care by management regarding the training. Once they have someone's money, they don't care how they do from there

review_title: Positive, supportive environment to grow your career
pros: Professional development was well supported. The management team had a strong level of care and empathy toward all staff members and created a very positive environment. Relationships between staff were collegial and special efforts were made by the team to recognise success every month and for the organisation at twice annual events.
cons: Career Progression was not viable within our particular team structure.

review_title: Not as good as they make out they are
pros: Other staff are good to work with
cons:
Owners in NSW are out of date and are not teaching latest techniques to students for fitness.
Pay is well below what laws say they should be
Do not know what they are doing
Are just totally worrying about what all the other colleges are doing and not at making their course compliant  and up to date
Last audit was not passed (public knowledge)
Will probably be out of business within six months have been doing heaps of redundancies around Australia

review_title: Amazing Company! The best in the business!
pros: The Australian Institute of Fitness has such a strong company culture and emphasis on balancing work and wellbeing. I am honestly excited to go to work every day! The team works so well together and is constantly trying to grow and innovate. You can really tell everybody is passionate about health, fitness and helping people reach their full potential.
cons: Can't think of any cons!

review_title: An empowering career with a dynamic company
pros:
Team culture and the ability to develop great strategy through difficult times.   Everyone working towards making Australia fitter and healthier is a motivating mission!  
Such variety in the role,  and everyone is there to support you to be the best version of yourself.
cons: The cons are insignificant compared to all of the amazing stuff.

pros:
The entire team are some of the most positive, inspiring and supportive people I have ever met! The resources and opportunities for growth are abundant everywhere and you really feel like you're playing a very special part in the company's mission!
The Christmas parties are also insanely good!
cons: I cannot find a single one.

review_title: Have loved every minute of growth and opportunity with the AIF
pros:
Support and guidance in the role
The transparency between all teams
Progression and changes implemented when suggestions made or growth in employee discovered
Leadership and management interaction
cons: Nothing pops to mind here

pros:
Flexible work hours
Curriculum is good
Teaching resources are good
cons:
Majority of work is evening/ weekend, and this is not negotiable
Old school emotional selling model
Sales team are top of the heap, those that do the work are at the bottom

review_title: Amazing company, great culture, making a difference
pros: Culture, leadership and how they manage tough times.  Great to know you are working towards making Australia healthier.
cons: The VET environment can be tough to navigate but the Institute does it well.

review_title: A place you can look forward to each day!
pros: Great environment, great working hours and heaps of support to grow.
cons: Cannot find one, this is a great place to work and study!

review_title: Most positive workplace I've ever worked in
pros:
- Positivity !
- Management !
- Culture !
cons: - No negative things as of yet !

pros: An empowering environment where everyone excels! Friendly and fun 'players' who are motivated and driven.
cons: Absolutely none! I love coming to "play" every day :-)

pros: Continuous personal and professional development. Iconic brand. Experienced people
cons: 13 hour days. Unmotivated students

pros: Top programs, great culture & still plenty of growth to be had
cons: Constant change in the industry. But that's exciting.

pros: Engaging & forward-thinking management team. Professional development opportunities. Fast-moving. Great culture!
cons: The VET environment can be tough to navigate but the Institute does it well.

pros:
Great company
Friendly and social culture
Hard-working employees
Great from the students right up to higher management
Love working here :)
cons: I can't think of any negatives

pros: Great people, great brand, great experience for staff & students
cons: I loved my time at the Institute
